TECHNIQUE.name: Variable from JSON file (dict)
TECHNIQUE.DESCRIPTION:
Read and merge successive local or remote JSON files to define a local variable. You can use these variables in the form `${your_namespace.variable_name}.`
The technique will start by defining a the variable with the _base file_, which is mandatory. Then, it will try to override this variable with the successive merge of the _override files_. If an _override file_ could not be found, it will not prevent the variable creation but will report an error.If an _override files_ entry is left blank/empty, it will not prevent the variable definition and will report a _not applicable_ report for this specific file.
For example a JSON containing `{ "datacenter": "paris" }` read into the variable `machine_info` with prefix `my_company` can be used in Directives and Techniques as `${my_company.machine_info[datacenter]}` and in a mustache template as `{{{vars.my_company.machine_info.datacenter}}}`.
TECHNIQUE.DEPRECATED: This technique version is not maintained anymore, it will no longer be available in the next stable version of Rudder. Please use group or node properties instead, or generic methods.

REGEX.error: The variable name must be of the form my_prefix.my_name

INPUT.NAME: VARIABLE_FROM_JSON_FILE_BASE_FILE
INPUT.LONGDESCRIPTION: Path relative to /var/rudder/configuration-repository/shared-files/ for remote sources. Absolute path for local ones.

INPUT.NAME: VARIABLE_FROM_JSON_FILE_JSON_FILE
INPUT.LONGDESCRIPTION: Path relative to /var/rudder/configuration-repository/shared-files/ for remote sources. Absolute path for local ones. It will override the previous one if necessary.
